articles.author: Jim Edwards
articles.title: The reason Turkey's economic collapse is so scary is because Iran, Russia, and Syria are waiting in the wings
articles.description: Turkey's president has warned that if things go badly for his country he will have to pivot away from the US and and seek "new friends" — a coded reference to Iran, Syria, and Russia — Turkey's immediate, troublesome neighbours.

articles.author: Ryan Pickrell
articles.title: China threatens foreign ships and planes 'daily' in the South China Sea, but no one is yielding any ground
articles.description: China threatens foreign ships and planes in the South China Sea on a 'daily basis,' according to members of the Philippine military. The US Navy called the warnings "routine." Despite Chinese hostility, none of the parties involved are backing down or yieldin…

articles.author: Catharine Paddock PhD
articles.title: Experimental drug may treat 'undruggable' cancers
articles.description: Researchers have found a way to block a cell signaling pathway that is common to many hard-to-treat cancers and has so far defied attempts to target it.

articles.author: Ana Sandoiu
articles.title: Herpesvirus may lead to bipolar, depression
articles.description: New research finds the herpesvirus HHV-6 in the brain cells of people who lived with severe depression, bipolar disorder, or both.

articles.author: Holly Ernst, PA-C
articles.title: Does birth control make people's boobs grow?
articles.description: The hormones in birth control pills can affect the body in various ways. In some people, the pills cause an increase in breast size. However, this change is usually temporary, and it may reverse within a few months. In this article, learn how birth control pi…

articles.author: Natalie Olsen, RD, LD, ACSM EP-C
articles.title: Best fruits to eat during pregnancy and what to avoid
articles.description: Eating a healthful diet is particularly important during pregnancy. The right nutrients help the fetus to develop and grow as it should. Pregnant women should eat a variety of fruits to provide them with healthful nutrients that may also help to relieve their…

articles.author: Christina Chun, MPH
articles.title: Chronic lymphocytic leukemia life expectancy and survival rates
articles.description: Chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) is a type of cancer that affects the blood and bone marrow. Although doctors can very rarely cure CLL, survival rates for this cancer are typically good. A person’s life expectancy for CLL depends on how far the cancer has p…

articles.author: Valinda Riggins Nwadike
articles.title: Labial hypertrophy: Causes, side effects, and treatment
articles.description: Each person's vagina and vulva are unique, and there is wide variation between people. Labial hypertrophy is when one or both vaginal lips, or labia, are larger than usual. This is normal and not a cause for concern. Some people choose to have surgery for cos…

articles.author: Holly Ernst, PA-C
articles.title: Skipping your period using birth control: Safety and how to do it
articles.description: Skipping one or more periods using the birth control pill is usually safe and poses few risks. A person may want to skip a period to avoid discomfort, for convenience, or for other reasons. Learn how to skip a period using birth control here. We also look at …

articles.author: William Morrison, MD
articles.title: 8 exercises for easing tennis elbow plus prevention tips
articles.description: Tennis elbow is a repetitive strain injury in the forearm. A person can usually treat it at home with rest and over-the-counter medication. Exercises that strengthen forearm muscles can also help ease the pain and prevent tennis elbow from reoccurring. Here, …

articles.author: Maria Cohut
articles.title: Leukemia: Do genes influence how people respond to therapy?
articles.description: Some people with acute myeloid leukemia are more responsive to chemotherapy than others. Why is this, and how can this knowledge lead to better treatments?

articles.author: Holly Ernst, PA-C
articles.title: Cramps after menopause: Causes, diagnosis, and treatment
articles.description: Although a person's monthly periods stop after they have been through menopause, they may still sometimes experience abdominal cramping. These cramps are usually nothing serious, but can sometimes be a sign of an underlying medical condition, such as uterine …

articles.author: Leah Crane
articles.title: Ancient natural nuclear reactors show how to store radioactive waste
articles.description: Billions of years ago, uranium in the Earth’s crust underwent nuclear reactions on its own, and the remnants demonstrate a way to keep nuclear waste under control

articles.author: Andy Coghlan
articles.title: We’ve identified the brain cells that let you control urination
articles.description: We’ve all been there – desperately holding on for a toilet. Now the brain cells that help us do it have been identified, which may lead to new incontinence treatments

articles.author: Yvaine Ye
articles.title: Asteroid strike may have forged the oldest rocks ever found on Earth
articles.description: The oldest rocks ever found are over four billion years old and we don’t know how they formed – but a massive asteroid bombardment may be responsible

articles.author: Michael Marshall
articles.title: Orca who carried her dead infant is not alone – many animals grieve
articles.description: A female orca has been seen carrying the body of her dead calf for 17 days, apparently grieving. Such displays of grief are remarkably common in nature

articles.author: Michael Marshall
articles.title: Rock layers show our sun has been in same cycle for 700 million years
articles.description: Our star gets more and less active in a repeating cycle that lasts 11 years, and ancient rocks suggest it behaved the same way over 700 million years ago

articles.author: Yvaine Ye
articles.title: NASA’s Parker Solar Probe is on its way to the sun, via Venus
articles.description: After a false start on Saturday, NASA’s Parker Solar Probe blasted off on Sunday to begin a mission to enter the sun’s scorching atmosphere

articles.author: Chelsea Whyte
articles.title: Tools reveal Easter Island may not have had a societal collapse
articles.description: Tools used to make Easter Island’s famous statues have yielded a clue that suggests the Rapa Nui inhabitants that made them all got along with each other

articles.author: David Satriano
articles.title: #NHLTopPlayers: Top 20 Defensemen
articles.description: Whether it's breaking up a big play, setting up a goal, or scoring on the power play, some defensemen can do it all. NHL Network experts chose the top 20 defensemen in the League for a special program that premiered Sunday as the second in a nine-part series …
